Backscaling for NMR Loadings

Source: R/AllGenerics.R
dot-load_backscaled_nmr.Rd

Computes backscaled loadings for visualization in NMR spectral space. The loadings are rescaled to original variable units using standard deviations from preprocessed input data. This is often used to interpret model loadings in terms of chemical shift.

Usage

.load_backscaled_nmr(mod, pc, idx, ppm)

Arguments

mod

An object of class PCA_metabom8 or OPLS_metabom8.

pc

Character or numeric. Principal or orthogonal component identifier (e.g., 1, "o1").

idx

Integer vector. Indices defining the region of interest in the ppm scale.

ppm

Numeric vector. Chemical shift axis in parts per million (ppm).

Value

A data.frame containing:

p_bs

Backscaled loadings for the selected component.

p_abs

Normalized absolute loadings (min-max scaled).

ppm

Chemical shift values (ppm).

Details

Backscaling is computed as: p_bs = p * sd(X), where p is the loading vector and sd(X) the original variable standard deviations.

Examples

# Example usage:
# df <- .load_backscaled_nmr(model, "1", get_idx(c(0.5, 4.5), ppm), ppm)
